questions.question_text: What must be modified on the administration page in Cisco UCM when designing layered security?

choices.A: phones that are on private VLANs

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Reference:
Preferred Architecture for Cisco Collaboration 12.x Enterprise On-Premises Deployments Cisco Validated Design (CVD) Guide.
Chapter 7 Security

Selected Answer: D
Confirming D.

To harden the phone, disable phone settings.
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/cucm/security/12_5_1/cucm_b_security-guide-1251/cucm_b_security-guide-1251_chapter_0111.html

By default, pressing the Applications button on a Cisco IP Phone provides access to a variety of information, including phone configuration information. Disabling the Setting Access parameter in the Phone Configuration window prohibits access to all options that normally display when you press the Applications button on the phone; for example, the Contrast, Ring Type, Network Configuration, Model Information, and Status settings.
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/cucm/security/10_5_2/cucm_b_security-guide-105x.pdf

comments.content: For CUCM Admin page Not the ip Phone hardening

choices.A: to provide internet connectivity and firewall traversal for voice and video
choices.C: to allow access on internal devices for management
choices.D: to provide internet connectivity via PSTN router
choices.B: to block access to ports 5060 and 5061

questions.question_text: What is the purpose of using an Expressway-C and Expressway-E pair in Cisco Collaboration Edge preferred architecture?

discussion.content: Cisco Expressway-C and Expressway-E, for Internet connectivity and firewall traversal for voice and video https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/solutions/CVD/Collaboration/enterprise/12x/120/collbcvd/edge.html

Selected Answer: A
Expressway C sits inside the network & E sits on the Edge providing Firewall traversal

choices.D: The destination is globalized using translation patterns to normalize the called party
choices.C: The destination is transformed using site-specific route patterns
choices.B: The normalization script modifies the calling party
choices.A: The calling party is globalized using translation patterns

questions.question_text: The enterprise network is migrating to a global dial plan and running a few devices in the test phase. Which change is performed by the system to the information dialed when the Cisco UCM endpoint dials an external destination under a global dial plan?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
A. is partially correct, the globalization of the calling party is performed with Calling Transformation patterns and/or external phone number masks.
B. is incorrect. There is not script as that, just Calling Transformation Patterns or External Phone number masks.
C. is incorrect. Globalization uses route patterns with +E164 format, not site-specific.
D. is correct. The destination is globalized using translation or transformation patterns to normalize the called party, before to be routed.
Reference: It is very well explained in the book "Implementing Cisco IP Telephony and Video, Part 2 (CIPTV2) Foundation Learning Guide" Chapter 3: Overview of PSTN and Intersite Connectivity Options.

Selected Answer: D
Confirming D.

Per Cisco documentation:
Cisco Unified Communications Manager uses various number patterns, such as route patterns or translation patterns, along with the value for the Calling Party Number Type to globalize a phone number. For example, you can configure Cisco Unified Communications Manager to take a localized German phone number of 069XXXXXXX with a Subscriber calling party number type and globalize it to +49 40 69XXXXXXX, which includes the German country code and city code. 
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/cucm/admin/12_5_1SU3/systemConfig/cucm_b_system-configuration-guide-1251su3/cucm_mp_ca9d6574_00_calling-party-normalization12-0.pdf

Selected Answer: C
Locations are settings configured in the Webex Control Hub for Webex Calling that allow you to group together any users and devices using the calling feature that have the same dialing behaviors based on their location.
CCNP and CCIE Collaboration Core CLCOR 350-801 Official Cert Guide
Chapter 26: Webex Calling Using a Local Gateway

Selected Answer: C
C appears to be correct per:

https://help.webex.com/en-us/article/7eedy0/Group-management

questions.question_text: Which Webex Calling construct is used to organize calling features within physical site?
Which option must be used when configuring the Local Gateway for a Cisco Webex Calling trunk?

discussion.content:
After you configure Webex Calling for your organization, you can configure a trunk to connect your Local Gateway to Webex Calling. SIP TLS transport secures the trunk between the Local Gateway and the Webex cloud. The media between the Local Gateway and Webex Calling uses SRTP.

B

Selected Answer: D
There are two options to configure the Local Gateway for your Webex Calling trunk:
 Registration-based trunk (not in the provided options)
 Certificate-based trunk (option D)
